sorcer.falcon.core.exertion

Class IfExertion

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.ServiceExertion
      • sorcer.falcon.core.exertion.IfExertion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Conditional, Evaluation<Object>, ExecState, Exertion, Identifiable, Invocation<Object>, Revaluation, Service

    public class IfExertion
extends ServiceExertion
implements Conditional
    The IfExertion implements the Conditional interface. It supports the branching algorithmic logic for the new exertions. It contains three components, the condition component, thenExertion and the elseExertion according to the if-else structure.
    Author:
    Michael Alger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      protected Map<String,Object> mapReference
      The map reference between the variable name and data node path.

      Logger for the provider logs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IfExertion

        public IfExertion()
        Default Constructor.

      • IfExertion

        public IfExertion(Exertion thenExertion,
          Exertion elseExertion)
        Overloaded constructor taking in two exertions implementing the Exertion interface. The first arguement is for the then exertion and the other as the else exertion.
        Parameters:
        thenExertion - the then exertion component
        elseExertion - the else exertion component

      • IfExertion

        public IfExertion(Conditional condition,
          Exertion thenExertion,
          Exertion elseExertion)
        Overloaded constructor which takes two exertions and an object implementing the Conditional interface. This conditional object contains the condition for this IfExertion.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition component
        thenExertion - the then component
        elseExertion - the else component

      • setConditionVariable

        public void setConditionVariable(String variableName,
                        String contextPath)
        This method allows to setup the condition without passing the condition object. It is done by first setting the variables in the condition boolean expression. The variables will be the reference to the actual data nodes in the dataContext by specifying the dataContext data nodes path as an argument.
        Parameters:
        variableName - Name of the variable for the conditional expression
        contextPath - Context path for a given variable name
        See Also:
        ServiceContext

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(String expression)
        Sets the boolean expression to be evaluated by the IfExertion if the Condition is not set. The variables in the expression is set by using setConditionVariable(String, String)
        Parameters:
        expression - the boolean expression
        See Also:
        WhileExertion#setConditionVariable(String, String)}
